content: Swatch could use its native — but circumscribed — cultural and technical skills to create beautiful, fun smartwatches…that run on Google’s software. Except Android is heavy which is everything Swatch is not. Android software requires a fast CPU and lots of RAM which then requires a bigger (and heavier) battery. Just look at every Android smartwatch out there and the biggest complaint is it’s size and little battery life. Samsung knew that to keep things closer to user acceptance they would have to develop their own lightweight OS (Tizen) that consumed less resources and would fit in a more commonly sized watch.
